title: authenticator
extract: An authenticator is a way to prove to a computer system that you really are who you are (called authentication). It is either: A piece of data (often called a token) that you got from the last place where you proved who you are (to save you, or the software, the hassle of logging in again).
extract_html: An authenticator is a way to prove to a computer system that you really are who you are (called authentication). It is either: A piece of data (often called a token) that you got from the last place where you proved who you are (to save you, or the software, the hassle of logging in again).
